programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

programme.desc: Ahmad Arbery was out jogging when three white men assumed he was a burglar, chased him down and shot him multiple times. Cellphone video captured by Arbery's assailants proved to the jury that these men were not the heroes they claimed to be.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome to Episode 30 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show presented by Duke Cannon! Adam Lamberti is BACK! He and the boys debate the 2026 #1 pick. Will it be Spanos or will is be Spallina? Adam gives us some more players to look out for heading into next years college season. The boys talk LEGACY, debating which top PLL player and coach needs a championship the most to boost their legacy. Now that Doogs' who should the mvp should've been rankings have come to an end, Kev puts his spin on it. Top 5 VILLAIN rankings. All of this and more on the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show!

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The $1,000 Ladies Event attracted 201 entrants and would see the final table headlined by Karina Jett and Susie Isaacs as nine lucky ladies look to capture the WSOP bracelet and $58,530 first-place prize.

programme.title: Cash of the Titans | 2025 | Day 2
programme.desc: Watch Day 2 of Cash of the Titans featuring Andrew Robl, Alan Keating, Sam Kiki, Justin Gavri, Kirk Brown, Shawn Madden, and Darin Feinstein, where the stakes will be $200/$400 and then $300/$600. Players are allowed two $100,000 bullets and post $75,000 in side money, with $150,000 being awarded to Day 2's biggest winner.

programme.title: Poker Masters 2021 Episode 1
programme.desc: The 2021 Poker Masters is underway with Event #1 seeing seven players return and David Peters in control as the chip leader. Peters sits ahead of Brock Wilson, Shannon Shorr, Jonathan Jaffe, Dylan DeStefano, John Riordan, and Ben Yu as they play for the $205,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Sean Perry leads the Event #2 final table while John Riordan returns to sit at his second final table of the series. Also in contention are Jeremy Ausmus, Jake Schindler, Sam Soverel, and Daniel Negreanu as the final six play for the $206,400 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The game changes to Pot-Limit Omaha at the 2021 Poker Masters with Matthew Wantman holding the lead. Chris Brewer, Jake Daniels, Adam Hendrix, Brent Roberts, and Jake Schindler are all in the mix for the $186,300 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Pot-Limit Omaha returns, as does Lou Garza with the chip lead. Garza looks for retribution in Event #9 ahead of Sean Winter, Miles Rampel, Jeremy Ausmus, and Ben Lamb as $365,500 awaits the winner.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Mikita Badziakouski holds the chip lead ahead of Ali Imsirovic, Daniel Negreanu, Jason Koon, and Seth Davies in Event 10. There is $342,000 awaiting the eventual winner, while Negreanu is eyeing the Poker Masters Purple Jacket.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: A massive $680,000 first-place prize awaits the winner in Event #11 as Australian Michael Addamo holds the chip lead. Trailing Addamo are Jason Koon, David Coleman, Cary Katz, and Alex Foxen who are all looking to grab their first Poker Masters title of the year.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The champion returns as the chip leader as Michael Addamo is eyeing back-to-back victories and the Poker Masters Purple Jacket. The final five players also include Nick Petrangelo, Stanley Tang, Alex Foxen, and Mikita Badziakouski as $1,160,000 awaits the Event #12 winner.

programme.title: The Scroll: Revelations
programme.desc: THE SCROLL: Revelations is the natural progression of one of the most transcending documentaries ever created. It delves into the spiritual relevance of todays day and age at even furher levels. A feature length film created to help inspire everyday people through real life parables and narrations from recognizable spiritual figureheads. Presented as a series of short vignettes recorded in an intimate, close-cropped setting to engage the viewer as if he or she is soul seeking wisdom at the foot of a sage. Weaving the journey and anecdotes of some of the most prolific high profile ministers, evangelists and church leaders of the 21st Century, The Scroll took three years to complete, interviewing over 50 of the U.S.'s most progressive and revered Spiritual Leaders.

programme.title: Stick Me Up
programme.desc: Follows the dynamic among a group of 12 perfect strangers who are suddenly plunged into a life-threatening situation together at a local diner.

programme.title: Sinful Paradise: Welcome to Paradise
programme.desc: The owner of one of the only female-owned clubs in the city, Cat and her business partner SP protect their dynasty. Looking at the stories and obstacles of it's dancers.

programme.title: Rackades
programme.desc: Three friends are thriving in a life of scamming and finessing. But one day they cross the wrong person and everything takes a turn.

programme.title: Queen of the Trap House
programme.desc: The girlfriend of a jailed drug kingpin hesitates when asked to take over as Queen of the trap house, but finds she’s better at it than she thought.

programme.title: Predatory Behavior
programme.desc: Sex workers are vanishing all over the city and Detectives Powell and Scott are running out of time to catch the culprit before he strikes again.

programme.title: But You Love Him
programme.desc: High school sweethearts Kelvin and Lydia have been dating for over 10 years but Lydia's promiscuous ways will lead them down a dark path and reveal an unspoken truth that will change both of their lives.

programme.title: Swept
programme.desc: Buried secrets come to light and new relationships develop when five old friends reconnect at their 20-year high school reunion.

programme.title: Cooperating Criminals
programme.desc: Tony's ambition ignites a powder keg of betrayal. Driven by Bianca's manipulation, he pushes his pill operation, ignoring Jay's warnings. As DEA Agent Harrison closes in, Jay battles his past to protect Tony. A dangerous deal with Marco, escalates the chaos, leading to overdose and murder plots. Now, Tony faces a stark choice: witness or prison.

programme.title: The Lineup
programme.desc: Sebastian "Bas" Monte is an up-and-coming influencer and club promoter. He doesn't have the time to commit to only one woman, so he schedules out different women for his needs. That is until he meets Mikayla, and he questions his playboy ways.

programme.title: Bottled Lust
programme.desc: Jasmine and her friends embark on a girls trip, as well as mend her heartbreak. She then meets John and is hit with a wave of feelings and butterflies. But when John starts to show his true colors, the girls end up in a dangerous situation.

programme.title: Troubled Mystic
programme.desc: Tracie is a single mother who meets Corey Daniels, the calculated and "perfect guy" looking for his next perfect family to manipulate by any means necessary.

programme.title: Wish
programme.desc: Unapologetically promiscuous and fiercely independent, Wish is not a fan of commitment until she meets a woman who changes everything.

programme.title: Deadly Housewife
programme.desc: Florence is a housewife who yearns for something new and exciting in her love life. Things turn deadly real quick when she doesn't get what she wants.

programme.title: Deceptive Intentions
programme.desc: The robbery and rape Vanessa witnessed as an impressionable young girl weave their way into her adult life with unintended and dangerous consequences.

programme.title: Dangerous Feelings
programme.desc: A happily married woman reconnects with an old flame when he is released from prison.

programme.title: Cuffin Season
programme.desc: When Nate's livelihood becomes dependent on his marital status, he makes it his mission to find a wife in a city where most are single.

programme.title: Caught in a Trapp
programme.desc: Drama following the journey of a teen boy who is forced into a dangerous life on the streets after the death of his parents.

programme.title: Boxed In 2
programme.desc: Rising boxing star Ria finds herself falling in love with a charming man, but the secrets that he keeps could destroy her future.

programme.title: South Side Hero
programme.desc: After serving a 10-year sentence on a RICO charge, reformed gangster Tommy "Ace" Crown returns home to find his 15-year old daughter Sierra missing after she ran away with a man she met online. When the police decline to help, Ace is determined to track her down himself.

programme.title: The Groomer
programme.desc: Layla is a young and attractive woman who meets Bryce in her teen years, and he is who she claims to be the love of her life. Unbeknownst to her, Bryse is manipulating her and forming her into his own object of desire. Layla is under his spell, until a different side of him that could destroy her.

programme.title: Complexx: The Two Exes
programme.desc: Dane is in a constant battle with love and lust. Haunted by both his dead sister and his mother, he fights his torment while being pursued by two ex-girlfriends. When the two women end up moving into his building, they begin a war of manipulation, on top of a masked killer running through the building. Who will make it out alive?

programme.title: The House on Adams Drive
programme.desc: Sean is convinced the only way to keep the woman of his dreams happy is by obtaining as much money as possible. His friend Kordell, who's an adult film star, helps him with a way to make a lot of money overnight. When they're sent to a house to possibly film a scene, that turns out to be a real life exorcism.

programme.title: Run of the Arrow
programme.desc: Dejected by the defeat of the Confederacy, O'Meara (Rod Steiger) heads west toward Sioux territory. The couple create a family together and live contentedly until Capt. Clark (Brian Keith) arrives with a group of cavalry, hoping to build a fort nearby. O'Meara acts as a scout for the troops until their wary peace is shattered.

His investigation brings him into contact with Lonesome Jackson, a miner who recently struck in rich & seeking a wife. The Treasury Department suspects Jackson because of the large bankroll he's carrying, but Yancy believes that the miner is being set up as a patsy by the real counterfeiters.

programme.desc: Yancy assists in transporting a Presidential pardon intended to save a Southerner who sided with the Union army from an unjust death sentence. Now Yancy must find a way to ease the last vestiges of the Civil War before someone dies!

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Will a shoe shaped pin cushion or a 1970s motorbike sell for the most at auction?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots. Also, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels across Central Spain. He begins at the vast, imposing palace and garden of the Escorial before heading for Madrid, Toledo, other parts of Castile and finally Valencia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don is in the south of Spain, visiting gardens that show how this part of the country has evolved thanks to influences from visitors and settlers from ancient to modern times.

programme.title: Monty Don's Spanish Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels across northern Spain, visiting gardens across this vast and diverse landscape that changes from an Atlantic to a Mediterranean climate as he journeys from Galicia to Catalonia.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows how almost anything that holds soil and drains water can be used to grow seasonal veg, salad crops and herbs. Frances Tophill visits some hardy gardeners on the Isle of Man.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the Gardeners' World team look back at the horticultural highs of the latest series and celebrate the very best inspirational gardens and gardeners up and down the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: July is a great time to get out and about visiting gardens, and this week, Monty Don travels to Cambridge for an exclusive tour of the gorgeous garden at Clare College. He'll also be catching up with various tasks at Longmeadow and, with luck, will be harvesting his first tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first big gardening weekend of the year gets underway with Monty dividing perennials and giving plenty of tips for how we can kick-start the garden for the season ahead. As millions of bedding plants are poised for planting in our pots and borders, Joe Swift visits a major grower to find out how they are produced and what drives the demand.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don visits the iconic garden of impressionist painter Claude Monet at Giverny. As well as revelling in the beauty and colour of Monet's paradise at this time of year, he has a privileged chat to Englishman James Priest, who, just this week, took up his role as head gardener of this world-renowned garden. Back at Longmeadow Monty shares his top tips for growing key culinary herbs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the garden growing before our eyes, Monty Don has plenty to be getting on with at Longmeadow. In preparation for late summer grass borders, he's filling the gaps that the diseased box hedges have left with grasses he's raised from seed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein is with Billy Carruthers in West Lothian, enjoying his wonderful and varied collection of flamboyant peonies. Joe Swift visits world-renowned opera venue Glyndebourne in Sussex and is given an exclusive tour of their gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team are Birmingham-bound for the annual Gardeners' World Live event. Monty Don, Arit Anderson, Adam Frost, Sue Kent, Carol Klein, Joe Swift, Rachel de Thame and Frances Tophill present the best the gardening world has to offer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With summertime at its peak, Adam plans to extend the season with plants for evening scent and shares the results of his wild meadow turf experiment. In North Yorkshire, Nick Bailey discovers the range of floral beauty of Cornus kousa.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives a masterclass on rambling, climbing and shrub roses. He also plants out tender annuals in the jewel garden, and with hot, dry summer days ahead, shares tips for water saving and harvesting.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The show comes from the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival. Arit Anderson, Toby Buckland and Adam Frost reveal the latest in floral fashions and share highlights of the show gardens and floral marquee.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Coming from the biggest horticultural event in the North, the RHS Flower Show Tatton Park. Joe Swift and Frances Tophill reveal the latest in garden design, as well as bringing plant perfection from some of the best nurseries in the country.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his spuds and sows seeds for autumn veg. He also shows how to get plants for free by taking cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With one of the driest summers in many years, Monty responds to viewers' questions and has plenty of advice on how to deal with drought conditions for vegetables, fruit, flowers and containers. Carol Klein celebrates one of the most flamboyant summer shrubs, the hydrangea.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty gives a masterclass on the summer pruning of fruit, gives advice on maintaining ponds and plants up a pot to give colour and interest to last into the autumn months. Adam Frost travels to Brodsworth Hall in South Yorkshire to meet a head gardener who has been set the challenge of restoring the gardens to their 19th century glory.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don tackles the perennial problem of what to grow in the shade beneath a tree, Carol Klein takes a look at the crocosmia and we meet a gardener in Derbyshire who has spent a lifetime growing and showing gladioli.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: It's the Easter weekend, which means extra time to get out and enjoy the garden. At Longmeadow, Monty plants out sweet peas for summer colour, gives advice on what to use for mulching borders and has plenty of ideas for jobs to get on with this long weekend. Carol Klein is at RHS Rosemoor to revel in the floral spring sensations that epitomise the season. In Scotland, JJ Chalmers explains how important his local park was in helping both his physical and mental rehabilitation.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As roses herald the real arrival of summer, the jewel garden starts to show signs of the abundance of colour that is to come. Monty Don prepares to surround the courtyard garden with scented summer pots.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Carol Klein continues her journey across the nation in search of amazing plant combinations. This week, she's at Logan Botanic Garden near Stranraer famed for its colourful, exotic borders. Joe Swift drops in on a street in Bristol as the residents prepare to be judged by RHS Britain in Bloom.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: A celebration of people who are growing their own, from vegetables to flowers, across the UK. At Longmeadow, Monty shares tips and advice on how to get the most out of bargain plants. Meanwhile, Joe visits an extraordinary food project in Bristol.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill is in her very first garden for a summer catch-up and an update on her progress since moving in. Meanwhile, Adam Frost meets a kindred spirit who explains how gardening saved his life.

programme.title: Dream Collection with Chris Jacobs | Canapa Motorsports and Surf City Garage
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours two amazing car collections. Chris' first stop is Bruce Canapa and his 70K-square foot Canapa Motorsports facility. Next, Chis visits the "Garage Mahal" of Kip Cyprus and his Surf City Garage.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | BMW vs. Tesla vs. Mercedes! Bentley vs. AMG vs. McLaren!
programme.desc: Jason Cammisa presents TWO episodes of his renowned Ultimate Drag Race Replay series. First, it's BMW M3 CS vs. Tesla Model 3 Performance vs. AMG C63 E Performance. Next , it's the Bentley Continental GT Speed vs. AMG GT63 vs. McLaren GTS.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | Quickest Cars Under $35K! Plus: Demon 170 vs. Lucid Sapphire!
programme.desc: First up, Jason races the quickest cars money can buy... for under $35,0000. Next, he crowns the quickest American car EVER in a battle between the Dodge SRT Demon 170 and the Lucid Air Sapphire.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | World's Fastest V-8 Wagons & Sedans! Plus: 1000+ HP "Mom Missiles"
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Jason Cammisa drag races the world's fastest V-8 wagons and sedans. Next, it's a "Mom Missile" showdown as Jason races 6 of the world's quickest SUVs, including the Gen-2 Rivian R1S Quad, Lucid Gravity Dream Edition and more!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | 2025 Aston Martin Vantage and Bentley Continental GT
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole reviews latest Aston Martin Vantage, equipped with a powerful twin-turbo V-8. Next, Henry drives the Bentley Continental GT which, while losing it's legendary W-12 engine, still provides a ton of fun via a hybrid-enhanced turbo V-8.

programme.title: Dream Collection with Chris Jacobs | Canapa Motorsports and Surf City Garage
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs tours two amazing car collections. Chris' first stop is Bruce Canapa and his 70K-square foot Canapa Motorsports facility. Next, Chis visits the "Garage Mahal" of Kip Cyprus and his Surf City Garage.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Will the faded pain on this dusty Ford Wagon shine like new?
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a property Midland, Texas, absolutely filled with old cars. An old Ford wagon catches his eye and Tom attempts to cut through the sun-faded, dust-covered quarter panel to reveal its former glory.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar Barn Find!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter helps "unearth" a 1952 Pegaso Z102, one of only 85 made, from a California garage. Next, we find Tom in South Carolina where he finds a plethora of American muscle cars, including a one-owner Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Ultimate BMW barn find, and a family feud over a "secret Chevy"
programme.desc: A Triumph Stag on a dead end road that leads Tom to a treasure trove of forgotten vacation cars hidden in 100-year-old barns. Next, we get the story of a family feud that caused a classic Chevy to be hidden away for decades.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | One-off fiberglass kit cars and a Cheetah Transporter
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores the wild world of one-off fiberglass kit cars. After that he uncovers a unique Cheetah Transporter.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 2020 Ford GT, 1976 Pontiac Trans-Am, Aston Martin DB4
programme.desc: Colin tries to put a value on a 2020 Ford GT that has one of the most desirable paint combinations and trim packages you could get in 2020. After that, Colin focuses his attention on a 1967 Pontiac Trans-Am and a 1962 Aston Martin DB4.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Modern-day California Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah explores the world of California-legal engine swaps and what they entail.Then, since EVs don't have to worry about emissions at all, Matt explores the new world of modifying Teslas for track-day performance.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | A Ferrari and a Ferrari-developed Maserati
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa wonders if the new Ferrari Roma is a return to the idea of an "everyday Ferrari." After that, Jason tells the fascinating story behind the Ferrari-developed Maserati Quattroporte V

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 367K-mile Barracuda, short-bed F100, & Ford Cortina GT Wagon
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hunts down a interesting Ford F100 short-bed pickup before coming across a Plymouth Barracuda with an incredible 367,000 miles on the odometer. Next, Tom finds the last Ford Cortina GT Wagon along with a handful of other rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Lifetime collection of old Fords & rare motorcycles
programme.desc: Tom Cotter reunites with an old friend from his NASCAR days and gets a tour of his collection of old Fords and rare motorcycles. After that, Tom uncovers an old Corvette and a handful of iconic British sports cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | The real reason Corvettes exist, plus some wild JDM cars
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds a "baby Corvette," also known as the Opel GT. Next, he comes across in interesting collection of Japanese sports cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 700 Cars Hidden on Colorado Ranch
programme.desc: Tom Cotter explores a ranch in Colorado that holds over 700 classic cars from a specific American brand the owner is quite fond of. Next, stick around for a batch of Barn Finds that didn't make it into previous episodes.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Tennessee barn finds: Chevys, Fords, Alfas, Fords and more
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to Tennessee where he finds a C2 Corvette and an Alfa Romeo Sprint along with a plethora of other Chevys, Fords and Mopars.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Porsche Roadtrip and the Fastest Porsche 959 Ever?
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole drives the Tail of the Dragon in a Porsche GT4 RS before giving us a history lesson on the fastest Porsche 959 ever built.

programme.title: The Appraiser | 1970 Plymouth Superbird, and a junkyard-built Bel Air Gasser
programme.desc: Colin Comer looks over a 1970 Plymouth Superbird that has plenty to offer any wing car enthusiast. Colin then takes a look at a 1956 Chevy that's been modified heavily into a SoCal street racer/gasser.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Underground vault at the Henry Ford, and 10 barn finds on one street
programme.desc: Tom gets a tour of the underground vault at the Henry Ford museum in Detroit, MI. Next, Tom comes across 10 interesting barn finds all on the same street.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Woodie Wagon craftsman and the story of Tom's Woodie
programme.desc: Tom Cotter meets an amazing craftsman who has spent many decades restoring and repairing woodie wagons and is one of the last people left in the world doing such work. After that, we get to hear the wild story behind Tom's Ford woodie wagon.

programme.title: Ultimate Drag Race Replay | The World's Quickest Trucks and SUVs
programme.desc: Race 1: World's Quickest SUVs: Rivian R1S vs Aston DBX 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 2: Rivian R1T vs RAM TRX vs Aston DBC 707 vs Cayenne Turbo GTRace 3: Bronco Raptor vs G63 AMG vs Jeep Wrangler 392 vs Defender V8 vs Gallardo

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | A trio of incredible Mercedes sports cars
programme.desc: Henry drives Mercedes’ SLS AMG Black Series and AMG GT Black Series, two of the wildest, rarest, most expensive cars ever to emerge from Affalterbach.Next, another famous Merc takes center stage as Henry reviews the McLaren Mercedes SLR HDK.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Spotting cars from an airplane
programme.desc: Tom Cotter rides shotgun in a small airplane in an attempt to spot old cars that would otherwise be hidden from view.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Dodge Charger and a field full of project cars
programme.desc: Tom Cotter hunts for barn finds in Midland, TX, where he finds a 1972 Dodge Charger for sale. Tom then gets the stories behind a yard full of old project cars.

programme.title: RadVentures | Defender and Range Rover off-roading, Ford F-150 Lighting racing
programme.desc: There's lots of fun to be had in these 80's and 90's icons! In this episode of RadVentures, Ryan Symancek goes offroading in a couple old Land Rovers. Next, a 700HP Ford SVT Lighting and $1500 Flareside F-150 go head-to-head on the track.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Merkur, Ford and the XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Revelations with Jason Cammisa feature untold stories of automotive legends. First, Jason tells the story of the Merkur XR4Ti and its Ford Sierra RS Cosworth cousin. Next, the Jeep Cherokee (XJ) takes center stage... as the best SUV ever?

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Modern Car Makeovers
programme.desc: Chip Foose gets to work on re-thinking the designs of a few recently updated models from Ford and BMW.

programme.title: RadVentures | V8 Audi Quattro rally car and a Nissan 240SX drift car
programme.desc: What sort of fun can be had with these icons of the 1980's and 1990's? In this episode, Ryan Symancek goes for a wild ride in modified V8 Audio Quattro rally car. Next, Ryan goes drifting in a modified Nissan 240SX.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | On the Track with Some Serious Race Cars
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole is on the race track with the legendary Ferrari 458 GTE and the new Maserati MC20 GT2

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Datsun, imported Ferrari, Swedish classics and a 289 Cobra name "Dirtbag"
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us a vast array of interesting barn finds from a low-mileage Datsun 510 to a imported Ferrari 400i. After finding a few Swedish classics in Michigan, Tom gets the story of how a 289 Cobra got the nickname, "Dirtbag."

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The NEW Ferrari Purosangue and Roma Spider
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives Ferrari's new V12-powered SUV in the mountains of northern Italy to try to decipher exactly what the Purosangue is all about.Next, Henry reviews the new Ferrari Roma Spider.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | De Tomaso Pantera locked in trailer for 35 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter opens up an old trailer to reveal a 1972 De Tomaso Pantera that had been stored there for 35 years. A few years later, we follow up with the gentlemen who bought and fully restored to car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rare Lotus Eleven, a 327 Corvette Stingray, a Chevy C10 with 148 original miles
programme.desc: This episode features a rare Lotus Eleven once owned by Colin Chapman, a 327 Chevy Corvette Stingray with a 4-speed, and a Chevrolet C10 pickup truck with only 148 miles on the odometer.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Hong Kong's Underground Car Scene, and Nissan Hyper Force
programme.desc: Larry Chen checks out Hong Kong's underground car scene. Next, Larry gets the inside scoop on the newly revealed Nissan Hyper Force concept electric hyper-car.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Split-window Chevy Corvette and Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose customizes one of his dream cars: the 1963 split-window Chevy Corvette.Part 2: Chip Foose transforms the classic Jaguar E-type coupe into a streetwise sports car with even sleeker design elements.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mercedes Gullwing found in storage unit!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us to a storage unit in an undisclosed location where an amazing prototype Mercedes-Benz 300SL Gullwing sits in completely unrestored condition. Tom then finds himself in California with some old Fords and Mercurys.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Chevy-powered Jaguar E-Type and a Ford Bronco Driveway Find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets the details on a Jaguar E-Type with Chevy V-8 powertrain. Next, he heads south to discover a long-owned Ford Bronco that's been sitting in a man's driveway for quite some time.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Classic Fords, Chevys and some dusty Italian sports cars!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole | Two rare JDM legends
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of two JDM legends: the Honda NSX-R and Nissan NISMO 400R

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Tokyo Drift Reborn; Totem Automobili
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Tokyo to check out the vibrant car scene that has gone from underground to mainstream. Next, Larry heads to Italy where he meets Riccardo Quaggio, the CEO of Alfa Romeo restomod builder, Totem Automobili.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The Lancia Delta S4 Stradale and a Lotus Elise restomod
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives one his dream cars, the Lancia Delta S4 Stradale.Next, Henry jumps in a Lotus Elise restomod that features some unique touches inspired by the legendary McLaren F1 supercar.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 5000 motorcycles? Plus, a plethora of Porsches
programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | McLaren P1 Spider and 750 S Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Mazda MX-5 and Alpine A110 R Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the latest Mazda MX-5 and the new Alpine A110 R.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a Ferrari-that-isn’t-a-Ferrari-but-is-a-Ferrari 246 GT “L-Series” Dino, a legit “Narrow Hip” 427 Shelby Cobra, and a Shelby CSX4000 427 S/C Cobra continuation car.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Skyline GT-R and Flame-spewing Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah drives two imported modified Nissan Skyline GT-Rs to discover what makes the Skyline the perfect tuner car for whatever your goal.After that, Matt takes you on a wild ride in some insane flame-throwing hot rods.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | R-Code Ford, De Tomaso Pantera, and Ford Hot Rods
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds an R-Code Ford Galaxie 500, a De Tomaso Pantera and a more. Next, he heads to Alaska and discovers a stash of Ford hot rods.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - AMC Pacer and "The Foosenberg"
programme.desc: Chip Foose reimagines the much maligned but legendary AMC Pacer as a custom delivery van.In part two of this program is a ""doozy!"" Chip explores the design of the legendary Deusenberg.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Lamborghini Revuelto and a unique Porsche restomod
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Lamborghini Revuelto with its hybrid drivetrain. Next, Henry drives the REEN Concept RSGT restomod which crams a water-cooled 997 GT3 engine in a 964 body.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - BMW M3 and Fox-body Ford Mustang
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose brainstorms modifications to an E30 BMW M3.Part 2: Chip takes his pen to the notchback Foxbody Mustang and explores what it may have looked like if Carroll Shelby had a hand in the design

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: The Appraiser | All about Ford Mustangs!
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a trio of interesting Ford Mustangs. A 1993 Ford SVT Cobra, 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz edition, and a 1966 Mustang with 350,000 miles on the odometer!

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, Porsche Boxster
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drive a Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, and a 2002 Porsche Boxster. Follow along as Magnus discovers whether or not these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole goes for a drive in MZR Roadsports Datsun 240Z restomod followed by an outing in Workshop 5001's amazing Porsche 911 restomod.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | American Classics in Detroit and Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.desc: There's lots of fun to be had in these 80's and 90's icons! In this episode of RadVentures, Ryan Symancek goes offroading in a couple old Land Rovers. Next, a 700HP Ford SVT Lighting and $1500 Flareside F-150 go head-to-head on the track.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Merkur, Ford and the XJ Jeep Cherokee
programme.desc: Revelations with Jason Cammisa feature untold stories of automotive legends. First, Jason tells the story of the Merkur XR4Ti and its Ford Sierra RS Cosworth cousin. Next, the Jeep Cherokee (XJ) takes center stage... as the best SUV ever?

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Modern Car Makeovers
programme.desc: Chip Foose gets to work on re-thinking the designs of a few recently updated models from Ford and BMW.

programme.title: RadVentures | V8 Audi Quattro rally car and a Nissan 240SX drift car
programme.desc: What sort of fun can be had with these icons of the 1980's and 1990's? In this episode, Ryan Symancek goes for a wild ride in modified V8 Audio Quattro rally car. Next, Ryan goes drifting in a modified Nissan 240SX.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Private tour of Collier Motors, an abandoned car dealership
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets a private tour of Collier Motors, an AMC dealership that was abandoned 40 years ago. Next, Tom is in Maine where he finds an LS-swapped Rolls Royce, Plymouth Barracuda, and a unique Harley Davidson.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | On the Track with Some Serious Race Cars
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole is on the race track with the legendary Ferrari 458 GTE and the new Maserati MC20 GT2

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Low-mileage Datsun, imported Ferrari, Swedish classics and a 289 Cobra name "Dirtbag"
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us a vast array of interesting barn finds from a low-mileage Datsun 510 to a imported Ferrari 400i. After finding a few Swedish classics in Michigan, Tom gets the story of how a 289 Cobra got the nickname, "Dirtbag."

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The NEW Ferrari Purosangue and Roma Spider
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives Ferrari's new V12-powered SUV in the mountains of northern Italy to try to decipher exactly what the Purosangue is all about.Next, Henry reviews the new Ferrari Roma Spider.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - 1970s Muscle
programme.desc: Chip Foose draws what his dream Chevelle would look like. Then he gives us his take on one of the most sought-after cars from the muscle car era, the Plymouth Cuda.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | De Tomaso Pantera locked in trailer for 35 years
programme.desc: Tom Cotter opens up an old trailer to reveal a 1972 De Tomaso Pantera that had been stored there for 35 years. A few years later, we follow up with the gentlemen who bought and fully restored to car.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX
programme.desc: This episode of Revelations with Jason Cammisa features the stories behind the Lamborghini Miura and the original Acura NSX

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Rare Lotus Eleven, a 327 Corvette Stingray, a Chevy C10 with 148 original miles
programme.desc: This episode features a rare Lotus Eleven once owned by Colin Chapman, a 327 Chevy Corvette Stingray with a 4-speed, and a Chevrolet C10 pickup truck with only 148 miles on the odometer.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mazda's Miata and RX-7
programme.desc: The unlikely success story of the Mazda MX-5 Miata: the world's bestselling 2-seat roadster and the only remaining true lightweight sports car.The 3rd-gen Mazda RX-7 has it all: beauty, performance, a Le Mans tie-in, and a sales failure.

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Hong Kong's Underground Car Scene, and Nissan Hyper Force
programme.desc: Larry Chen checks out Hong Kong's underground car scene. Next, Larry gets the inside scoop on the newly revealed Nissan Hyper Force concept electric hyper-car.

programme.title: Patrick Dempsey Returns to Racing in "Back on Track"
programme.desc: "Back on Track" takes you behind the scenes of actor Patrick Dempsey's return to racing. Joined by longtime friend and fellow Porsche driver Patrick Long, the two Patricks race in the North America Porsche Endurance Challenge.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Split-window Chevy Corvette and Jaguar E-Type
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose customizes one of his dream cars: the 1963 split-window Chevy Corvette.Part 2: Chip Foose transforms the classic Jaguar E-type coupe into a streetwise sports car with even sleeker design elements.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Prototype Mercedes Gullwing found in storage unit!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter brings us to a storage unit in an undisclosed location where an amazing prototype Mercedes-Benz 300SL Gullwing sits in completely unrestored condition. Tom then finds himself in California with some old Fords and Mercurys.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Chevy-powered Jaguar E-Type and a Ford Bronco Driveway Find
programme.desc: Tom Cotter gets the details on a Jaguar E-Type with Chevy V-8 powertrain. Next, he heads south to discover a long-owned Ford Bronco that's been sitting in a man's driveway for quite some time.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Classic Fords, Chevys and some dusty Italian sports cars!
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds himself in Michigan again where he comes upon a pole barn full of Chevys and Fords that owner Denny has all sorts of stories about. Tom then heads to the other end of the state for some European sports car barn finds.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat w/ Henry Catchpole | Two rare JDM legends
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole gets behind the wheel of two JDM legends: the Honda NSX-R and Nissan NISMO 400R

programme.title: Capturing Car Culture w/ Larry Chen | Tokyo Drift Reborn; Totem Automobili
programme.desc: Larry Chen heads to Tokyo to check out the vibrant car scene that has gone from underground to mainstream. Next, Larry heads to Italy where he meets Riccardo Quaggio, the CEO of Alfa Romeo restomod builder, Totem Automobili.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - Pontiac Aztec and an Off-Road Dodge Caravan
programme.desc: Watch as Chip Foose attempts to tackle the design flaws of the often ridiculed Pontiac Aztek.Next, Chip thinks the original Dodge Caravan could use some performance and aesthetic upgrades and produces something... unexpected!

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | The Lancia Delta S4 Stradale and a Lotus Elise restomod
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole drives one his dream cars, the Lancia Delta S4 Stradale.Next, Henry jumps in a Lotus Elise restomod that features some unique touches inspired by the legendary McLaren F1 supercar.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | $4M Barn Find - Rare Ferrari and 427 Shelby Cobra hidden for decades
programme.desc: Tom makes an incredible discovery! Behind the doors of a condemned garage lies two amazing cars, a 1966 Ferrari 275 GTB/2 and a 1967 Shelby Cobra 427. Follow along as Tom discovers, helps extract, and then attends the auction for these rare cars.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 5000 motorcycles? Plus, a plethora of Porsches
programme.desc: Tom Cotter introduces us to Steve and his insane collection of motorcycles. After that, Tom stumbles upon and interesting stash of Porsches.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | McLaren P1 Spider and 750 S Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews a one-off McLaren P1 Spider and the new McLaren 750 S.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Mazda MX-5 and Alpine A110 R Reviews
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the latest Mazda MX-5 and the new Alpine A110 R.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Wild Ferrari Restomod and the Oft-forgotten TVR Tuscan
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the gorgeous RML SWB Ferrari 250 GT restomod before jumping into an amazing car that most people may not be familiar with: the TVR Tuscan.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | New V-12 sports cars: the Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews new Ferrari 12 Cilindri and Aston Martin Vanquish. Both are powered by V-12 engines with the former being naturally aspirated and the latter adding a turbocharger.

programme.title: Revelations with Jason Cammisa | The Stories Behind Mercedes' 300SL and W124 500E
programme.desc: In this episode of Revelations, Jason Cammisa explores the fascinating histories behind two of Mercedes' most iconic cars.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Ferrari Dino and Two Different Shelby Cobras
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a Ferrari-that-isn’t-a-Ferrari-but-is-a-Ferrari 246 GT “L-Series” Dino, a legit “Narrow Hip” 427 Shelby Cobra, and a Shelby CSX4000 427 S/C Cobra continuation car.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | 1,800 cars in remote area of California
programme.desc: Tom Cotter heads to the "middle of nowhere" in rural California where a unique collection of 1,800 classic cars is slowly returning to the earth. Next, we find Tom in the Carolinas where he discovers a 1954 Chevy Corvette and so much more.

programme.title: MODIFIED - Skyline GT-R and Flame-spewing Hot Rods
programme.desc: Matt Farah drives two imported modified Nissan Skyline GT-Rs to discover what makes the Skyline the perfect tuner car for whatever your goal.After that, Matt takes you on a wild ride in some insane flame-throwing hot rods.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | R-Code Ford, De Tomaso Pantera, and Ford Hot Rods
programme.desc: Tom Cotter finds an R-Code Ford Galaxie 500, a De Tomaso Pantera and a more. Next, he heads to Alaska and discovers a stash of Ford hot rods.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - AMC Pacer and "The Foosenberg"
programme.desc: Chip Foose reimagines the much maligned but legendary AMC Pacer as a custom delivery van.In part two of this program is a ""doozy!"" Chip explores the design of the legendary Deusenberg.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | GM muscle cars, rotary Mazdas, and Ford Broncos
programme.desc: Tom Cotter stumbles upon some GM muscle cars, including a Buick GS Stage 1 and some Oldmobile 442s. Next, Tom finds an interesting old Mazda RX-4 along with a stash of some vintage Ford Broncos.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Lamborghini Revuelto and a unique Porsche restomod
programme.desc: Automotive journalist Henry Catchpole reviews the new Lamborghini Revuelto with its hybrid drivetrain. Next, Henry drives the REEN Concept RSGT restomod which crams a water-cooled 997 GT3 engine in a 964 body.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Fast Wagons: Audi RS4 Avant and BMW M3 Touring
programme.desc: Henry Catchpole puts the latest fast Audi Avant through its paces around town, in the hills and on the amazing Ascari race track in Southern Spain.Next, Henry jumps in another high-performance wagon, the BMW M3 Touring.

programme.title: Chip Foose Draws a Car - BMW M3 and Fox-body Ford Mustang
programme.desc: Part 1: Chip Foose brainstorms modifications to an E30 BMW M3.Part 2: Chip takes his pen to the notchback Foxbody Mustang and explores what it may have looked like if Carroll Shelby had a hand in the design

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Barn finds of the Owls Head Transportation Museum
programme.desc: What happens to barn finds if nobody buys them? Well, Tom Cotter finds out that some of them end up at Owls Head Transportation Museum in Owls Head, Maine. Next, Tom uncovers a "Frankenstein" Jaguar E-Type with a Chevy V-8 engine.

programme.title: The Appraiser | Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" GT Mustang, and a Honda S2000
programme.desc: Colin Comer takes a look at a rust-free Alfa Romeo GTV-6, a "K-Code" Ford Mustang GT, and a 2004 Honda S2000 with only 80,0000 miles.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | Millon-dollar barn find collection inherited by 3 sisters
programme.desc: Tom Cotter does what he does best: uses a barn find to learn about ANOTHER barn find! A unique LaSalle eventually leads to a $1,000,000 collection of 40 barn finds that 3 sisters just inherited from their recently passed father.

programme.title: The Appraiser | All about Ford Mustangs!
programme.desc: Colin Comer appraises a trio of interesting Ford Mustangs. A 1993 Ford SVT Cobra, 1966 Shelby GT350 Hertz edition, and a 1966 Mustang with 350,000 miles on the odometer!

programme.title: The Next Big Thing with Magnus Walker | Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, Porsche Boxster
programme.desc: Urban Outlaw Magnus Walker drive a Saleen Fox-body Mustang, Saab 900 SPG, and a 2002 Porsche Boxster. Follow along as Magnus discovers whether or not these vehicles might be The Next Big Thing in the collector car world.

programme.title: The Driver's Seat with Henry Catchpole | Datsun 240Z and Porsche 911 Restomods
programme.desc: In this episode of The Driver's Seat, automotive journalist Henry Catchpole goes for a drive in MZR Roadsports Datsun 240Z restomod followed by an outing in Workshop 5001's amazing Porsche 911 restomod.

programme.title: Barn Find Hunter | American Classics in Detroit and Big-block Camaros in Arizona
programme.desc: Tom Cotter discovers some amazing barn finds in Detroit, MI, including a Buick Caballero, a pair of Pontiac GTOs and a pair of Jaguar XK140s. Next, we find Tom in Arizona where he uncovers some interesting Mopars and two Big-block Chevy Camaros.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: The Crew heads to Rivers Lodge and Hunt Club in Kansas to fish strip pits. Trenton and Rex take on Mike and Nate in a 3 period mini tournament. With multiple species allowed including northern pike, the two teams are neck and neck after the first two periods. Due to bad weather on day 2, period 3 turned into a hour speed round where only keeper largemouth count.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: In rural Wisconsin, we follow the Yackley family who has dedicated their lives to competitive shooting. The five-member crew is the most decorated family in shooting sports. Becky Yackley gives tips to new shooters and then teams up with Chris Keefer to review Winchester USA Ready.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over 70 years ago, John Olin took 600 acres of farmland joined by timber and turned it into a wildlife oasis in hopes of creating an ideal place to raise and train the best Labradors Retrievers in the country. He called it Nilo, which was also Olin’s model of conservation. Today, Nilo is still considered one of the most prestigious hunting and shooting preserves in the nation. This is the story of Nilo.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The story of the game changing 350 Legend cartridge is documented at deer camps across the midwest with the Keefer Brothers in Kansas, Mark and Terry Drury in Missouri, Melissa Bachman in Nebraska and Team Winchester back in Missouri.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: The collaboration story between Winchester and Browning to create the groundbreaking 6.8 Western is featured. Tag along on a mule deer hunt in Utah with Chris Keefer and Winchester’s Jason Gilbertson, then follow Casey Keefer to Colorado for elk and Nebraska for whitetail where the 6.8 Western is put to the test.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 2: New Orleans, Josh links up with Mason Hereford (owner of award-winning sandwich shop Turkey and the Wolf) and then hits the road for some epic hog hunting, swamp fishing, crawfish and oyster harvesting, and exploring Louisiana’s only water buffalo dairy farm. It all culminates in one incredible feast featuring unique regional dishes prepared by Mason with the help of some local friends.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float plane—a new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, “the land of earth, sea, and sky.” All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaska’s abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. There’ll be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for now—join us—there are halibut to filet, rainforest ’shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook

In this episode, Jay Ducote will visit Delacroix Island where he will connect with Captain Nick Rando and be assigned the task of cooking EVERYTHING that’s caught during their day out on the water. As unpredictable fog rolls in, the morning starts off with a slow bite and the crew wonders if they’ll have anything to eat that night.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didn’t expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesn’t work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, that’s where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish she’s never caught before. Lo and behold, it’s a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this in-depth episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV, the team explores what it truly takes to implement an advanced food plot strategy. We go beyond the basics, walking viewers through soil science, crop rotation, plot placement, and how to integrate food plots into a larger habitat management plan.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. The team shares real-world scenarios and proven strategies to foster cooperation, avoid conflict, and build relationships that lead to better deer hunting for everyone.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: From fuzzy velvet to hardened bone, antlers are more than headgear—they're nature’s calendar. In this episode of Deer & Deer Hunting, we explore the fascinating stages of whitetail antler development, what they reveal about a buck’s age and health, and how understanding this process can help you become a better hunter. Join us as we break down the biology, bust myths, and show real examples from the field.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Can the everyday landowner really manage their property well enough to hold and retain mature bucks year after year? From habitat improvements and food plots to pressure control and property layout, discover what truly influences a buck’s decision to stay—or stray.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this in-depth episode of Deer & Deer Hunting TV, the team explores what it truly takes to implement an advanced food plot strategy. We go beyond the basics, walking viewers through soil science, crop rotation, plot placement, and how to integrate food plots into a larger habitat management plan.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Whether you're hunting 10 acres or 1,000, how you handle boundaries, buck movement, and communication with neighboring hunters can make or break your season. programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion

programme.title: Friends with Kids

programme.title: Local Hero

programme.title: Elvis: That's The Way It Is (Special Edition)

programme.title: Imagine: John Lennon

programme.title: Jimi Hendrix

programme.title: Hot to Trot

programme.title: The Stupids

programme.title: My Giant

programme.title: Almost Heroes

programme.title: Every Time We Say Goodbye

programme.title: Random Hearts
