programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Everyone needs a hobby, but these collectors take things to another level.

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: After making two of the last three state championships St John’s Prep High School is on a mission to defend their reputation. A down-to-the-wire controversial call will decide their fate in the 2024 tournament.

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Relive the '50s, sip smokin’ cocktails, and discover salty licorice fish in Amish country's hidden gem.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: The crew’s 30-day kindness blitz brings joy to packed crowds and local communities, serving up French toast, tipping drive-thru heroes, mowing a random lawn and capping it off with a solo show on a dedicated fan's doorstep.

programme.title: The Lost Children of Carlisle
programme.desc: A powerful look at the history of Native American boarding schools as told through the stories of tribal members and their surviving family members, who endured an educational system founded on the concept “Kill the Indian in him, and save the man.”

programme.title: Escaping The Blade
programme.desc: Why California's sex traffickers are walking free while victims wait in fear and how organizations are fighting to protect survivors.

programme.title: Show Me Milwaukee
programme.desc: Filipino food entrepreneur, Alexa Alfaro shows Greg around Milwaukee as they gather people for a special Kamayan dinner. Greg learns family cooking secrets, explores the Sherman Phoenix, becomes a train conductor and learns to drive a food truck.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: 12-foot-tall skeletons on display all year at some New Hampshire homes.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: Splish splash, will the would-be criminals take a bath? These wild stories wind up in bodies of water that you have to see to believe.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Chefs Nate Schoedel and Ivan Gil-Silva are casting their nets for the best Catch of the Day dishes in today's seafood showdown. Can our chefs reel in a victory? Or will they let the big one get away?

programme.title: Stitch
programme.desc: Life is all about the friendships we make. These bonds inspire us, drive us, support us, and can even save lives. In this episode, we explore special friendships across the country doing just that.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Michael Ferrazzani, creator of Ya Mamma’s sauce, challenges the North End born Italian stallion, Chef Kenny Palazzolo, to a true neighborhood duel. Can Michael’s Grandma inspired dish bring down the chef who lives, laughs and cooks Italian?

programme.title: Eat Play Stay
programme.desc: Venture into Taos, New Mexico! Engage with the sacred traditions and life lessons of the people of Taos Pueblo, experience life off-the-gridn and enjoy thrilling river rafting adventures on the Rio Grande.

programme.title: One Pill Can Kill
programme.desc: Told through the voices of grieving parents, this documentary follows the real and lasting impact of the fentanyl crisis. Capturing the aftermath of sudden loss, the search for answers, and the transformation of grief into public advocacy.

programme.title: Free Spirit
programme.desc: Kate learns how to play a Germantown street game, gets up close and personal with handcrafted, hand-charred bourbon barrels, and learns to fall back in love with whiskey – and natural wine.

programme.title: WMUR CloseUp
programme.desc: On CloseUp, political analyst Scott Spradling said former President Donald Trump showed he was a "changed man" during his speech at the Republic National Convention.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Keep your outdoor oasis vibrant all season long.

programme.title: Completed Episodes
programme.desc: In what has to be the stinkiest episode we've ever had, Frank Nicotero asks Cincinnati locals wild and wacky news trivia. You'll be glad you can't smell some of these stories.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: Salem spots that will help burn off some of that cabin fever.

programme.title: Boston Rob Does Beantown
programme.desc: Rob proves that this iconic locale is more than just Ivy League. He makes pasta from scratch, crafts a custom knife and tries to make an escape from one of the toughest spots in all of Beantown.

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Kinga is in Manchester, NH, to meet Matt Krajcik, a 26-year-old curriculum developer who survived a trying childhood. Now he is looking to reconnect to the nature around him that provided respite when he was young.

programme.title: Heroes On Call
programme.desc: In the 1960s, Americans were dying at shocking rates due to inadequate emergency care. Enter Freedom House Ambulance Service: the first paramedics unit in the U.S., run and staffed by Black men and women. This is the origin story of EMS.

programme.title: Grit of Greenwood
programme.desc: Greenwood was a thriving Black district in Tulsa when, 100 years ago, it was destroyed in less than 24 hours.

programme.title: Shift: The Ragbrai Documentary
programme.desc: A celebration of the oldest, largest, and longest recreational touring bicycle ride in the world. Three riders and a pair of community leaders reach new personal heights, changing their lives along the seven day ride across Iowa.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: As Girl Scouts at Camp Scott settle into their tents one evening, eerie footsteps and distant cries haunt the campers throughout the night. The unsettling sounds turn out to be the echos one of the largest murder investigations in Oklahoma's history.

programme.title: New Hampshire Chronicle
programme.desc: A Not So Tiny House.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: After a South Carolina couple vanishes, social media posts begin cropping up claiming the pair is fine and eloped. But their loved ones are convinced they're not the ones who penned the posts, and the truth is more shocking than anyone imagined.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: From a car crashing into a home to a lemur fleeing a DUI scene, these captivating real-life stories explore intense arrests caught on film.

programme.title: Hockey Night in New England
programme.desc: Meet #1 on the Boston Bruins: Jeremy Swayman. This top NHL goalie began his career in his home state of Alaska and has been blocking shots ever since, from his college career at the University of Maine all the way to the big leagues in Boston.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A beloved University of Kentucky football player is murdered on the porch of his house during his 21st birthday party in an assassination-style killing. What leads to the shooter's capture is equally shocking.

programme.title: Stitch
